context_of_use: The manager reviews and authorizes customer orders within the order management system.
description: Enable managers to review and authorize customer orders to progress business workflows.
preconditions: The manager is logged into the system.
There are pending orders to be approved.
postconditions: The order status is updated to approved.
The order is processed for fulfillment.
assumptions: The manager has the necessary permissions to approve orders.
requirements_met: The manager can view pending orders.
The manager can approve or reject orders.
main_flow: 1. Manager logs into the system → System authenticates the manager.
2. Manager views pending orders → System displays the list of pending orders.
3. Manager selects an order to approve → System updates the order status to approved.
4. System notifies the customer of the order approval.
alternative_flows: AF-1 (from Step 3): Manager rejects the order → System updates the order status to rejected and notifies the customer.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 1): Manager fails to log in → System displays an error message.
information_for_steps: 2. List of pending orders with details.
